newsitem.title: DOMINICAN REPUBLIC: Seven dead, 15 missing in Dominican shipwreck.
newsitem.headline: Seven dead, 15 missing in Dominican shipwreck.

text.p: Seven people drowned and 15 were missing and feared dead after a ship believed to be carrying illegal Dominican migrants sank on Friday morning off the south coast of the Dominican Republic, the military said.

The vessel left eastern Boca Chica on Thursday night with 35 people onboard, an armed forces statement said. But it sank off the south coast near Oviedo apparently after bad weather forced it off course.
Navy and air force units taking part in the rescue effort were only able to find 13 survivors. Of the seven dead, four were women and three were men, the statement said.
The vessel was believed to be carrying illegal migrants trying to reach Puerto Rico, from where they can easily enter the United States, and was forced to the south coast by strong winds.
